result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J. Goyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1-15CF393 & Count #2-16CF128, the Court sentences Mr. Goyer to 5 and one half years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 30 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years, each count, concurrent. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being.

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay statutory costs and fees of these actions

--To pay DNA Surcharge

--To reimburse $90 buy money
--To engage in legitimate efforts to obtain/maintain employment

--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription

--No possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and approved by Agent

--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent

--To comply with any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent

--Random drug/alcohol screening

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Transcript of 6/3/16 Plea and Sentencing Hearing

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF393, 16CF128 & 16CM53 called together at 2:56 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Christopher J. Goyer in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-15CF393 & Count #2-16CF128; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 16CM53 and all remaining Counts in 15CF393 & 16CF128
ADA Shock clarifies that there is an error on the criminal case settlement form - 30 months & 3 years adds up to 5.5 years
Mr. Goyer affirms his No Contest pleas and informs the Court that he does not wish to withdraw pleas based upon error on form

On Count #1-15CF393 & Count #2-16CF128, the Court sentences Mr. Goyer to 5 and one half years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 30 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years, each count, concurrent. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being.

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 90 days credit for time already served-15CF393
The Court gives 76 days credit for time already served-16CF128

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To comply with any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random drug/alcohol screening
--To engage in legitimate efforts to obtain/maintain employment
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and approved by Agent
--To pay statutory costs and fees of these actions
--To pay $500 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $426.84 extradition fees (15CF393)
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To reimburse $90 buy money (15CF393)

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 3:47 pm

Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV

Attorney Lavoy requests an anticipated plea and sentencing date.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 2:43pm

As to Cases 15CF393 and 16CF128 (Waiver of Preliminary hearing occurs):

NEXT: to continue as scheduled

Cases 15CF393 & 16CM53 called together at 10:07 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Christopher J. Goyer in court,in-custody, with Attorney Jessica Rowe on behalf of Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rowe informs the Court that they do not object to the State's motion however they do request that the $500 not be forfeited and remain on file as Mr. Goyer will not be posting the bond; No objection by the State
Court grants the State's motion to modify bond, but does order that the $500 cash bond remain on file and not be forfeited, so only an additional $2000 needs to be posted and all non-monetary conditions are to remain the same

Court requires a $2500 CASH bond ($500 already posted), to cover both files, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--take all medications as prescribed
Counsel agree that both cases shall remain as scheduled
Recess: 10:09 am 

NEXT: Both cases to remain as scheduled
Defendant should be brought before Branch 4 upon execution of the warrant
State's warrant request based upon Notice of Bond Violation(s.)
Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on April 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Bond signed on 3-4-16 and received by COC on 3-7-16

case called at 1:18pm. 
Defendant Christopher J. Goyer appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. Lavoy indicates that Mr. Goyer has another pending case, requests that case 16CM53 be called for an initial appearance as well
PSSP Flint exits to obtain file


recess: 1:20pm--reconvene: 1:25pm
The Court calls cases 15CF393 and 16CM53; all appearances remain the same.

As to Both Cases:
The Court verifies name, date of birth and address on criminal complaints
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Bond arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $500  CASH bond to cover cases 15CF393 and 16CM53, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--take all medications as prescribed

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
No Demand for speedy trial in misdemeanor file

recess 1:31  pm. 


NEXT: As to Both Cases: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/23/16 at 11:40am  (2) Status Conference on 4/29/16 at 2:30pm
Duplicate Original Warrant received from JCSD - Defendant is in custody
Courts Response to Request for Substitution of Judge : The Court concludes the request is timely and in the proper form per 971.20 Wis Stat
